sources.full: The Gunslinger Class: Valda's Spire of Secrets (Extras)

subclassFeature.name: Pistolero
entries: {@i Fire Six-Shooters with Incredible Speed}

Bullets are power, and you have long believed that more bullets equal more power. Your expertise is in delivering a hail of deadly fire to pulverize your enemies. Not every bullet needs to be accurate to make a difference.

subclassFeature.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Fan the Hammer [Maneuver]
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a Ranged weapon that doesn't have {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}, you can expend one Risk Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make two additional ranged attacks with that weapon. These additional attacks always have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, regardless of circumstance. You can't use the {@itemMastery Automatic|ValdaGunslinger} mastery property with these attacks, and you must have a free hand to use this maneuver.

subclassFeature.name: Disarm
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} and trigger your {@classFeature Gut Shot|Gunslinger|ValdaGunslinger|5} feature against a creature, you can disarm the target instead of lodging a projectile in it. The target drops one object of your choice that it's holding, with the object landing in a space of your choice up to 15 feet away from the target.

subclassFeature.name: Showdown [Maneuver]
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can expend one Risk Die to draw a Ranged weapon and make an attack using it. Add the Risk Die to the damage roll. On a hit, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than you on the first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Bullet Time
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make a ranged attack using a weapon, you can gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Gun Tank
entries: {@i Be Huge and Wield Huge Guns}

Be bigger, be badder, and be tougher, and no one will stand in your way. You are a living siege engine, a titan of muscle, brandishing weapons most people are incapable of lifting. Armed with these devastating firearms, you wade into the field of battle, bombarding and destroying those foolish enough to oppose you.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Gunner
entries: You can lug around massive guns and shrug off incoming bullets, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Medium and Heavy armor.

entries.name: Strong Attacks
entries: You can use Strength, rather than Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls using Ranged weapons. You can also add your Strength, instead of Dexterity, to your Maneuver save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Walking Turret
entries: Your experience with mounted weapons grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Mounted Arsenal
entries: While you are holding a Ranged weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can use the {@itemMastery Mounted|ValdaGunslingerExtras} mastery property with that weapon. While a weapon is mounted in a fixed position, its damage dice increase by one step ({@dice d4} → {@dice d6} → {@dice d8} → {@dice d10} → {@dice d12}, to a maximum of d12s).

entries.name: Move While Mounted
entries: You can move a weapon with the {@itemMastery Mounted|ValdaGunslingerExtras} mastery property that is in a fixed position. While moving with such a weapon, every foot of movement costs 1 extra foot.

subclassFeature.name: Thick-Skulled
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Bulletproof
entries: When you use your {@optfeature Bite the Bullet|ValdaGunslinger} maneuver, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gatling Shot
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you hit an enemy with a ranged attack using a weapon, you can make another attack with the weapon against the same target. This attack is always made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, regardless of circumstance. If this attack hits, you can make another attack against the same target. You can repeat this attack until you miss or make a total of five attacks against the target.

subclassFeature.name: Grenadier
entries: {@i Blow Up Anything in Your Way}

You believe that virtually all problems can be solved with the careful application of high-explosives, and will go to great lengths to prove this thesis. Demolitions are your expertise, and anything that can cause explosions at long range is your instrument. If you must, you can make do with an ordinary gun, but it's simply not as satisfying as blowing your enemies into smithereens.

subclassFeature.name: Explosive Shot
entries: When you make a ranged attack using a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property for that attack. The damage of this attack is Fire instead of the weapon's normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Ordnance [Maneuver]
entries: Whenever you use a weapon's {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend one Risk Die to increase the explosion's radius to a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. Add the Risk Die to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Configurable Blast
entries: When you use a weapon's {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, you can choose one of the following benefits for that attack.

entries.name: Demolition Blast
entries: The explosion deals double damage to objects and ignores the damage threshold of objects.

entries.name: Elemental Blast
entries: You cause the explosion to deal Acid, Cold, Lightning, or Thunder damage rather than its normal damage type.

entries.name: Incendiary Blast
entries: Flammable objects in the area of the explosion that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

subclassFeature.name: Take Cover
entries: Each creature you choose gains the benefits of your {@classFeature Evasion|Gunslinger|ValdaGunslinger|7} feature while it is within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Clusterbomb
entries: When you use a weapon's {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, you can fire a Clusterbomb. The explosion is a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d6} Fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. A Huge or smaller creature that takes damage from the Clusterbomb has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending four Risk Dice (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Musketeer
entries: {@i Lead Your Allies with Blades and Bullets}

You believe that camaraderie and glory go hand-in-hand, that you and your allies are undefeatable as long as you stand together. As a Musketeer, you have trained with blades and firearms in tandem so that you might battle shoulder-to-shoulder alongside your allies. Your place isn't taking shots from afar, but charging into the fray such that you might all succeed or fail as one.

subclassFeature.name: Infantry Training
entries: You have received training in warfare that mixes firearms with conventional weapons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Martial Weapons
entries: You gain proficiency with all Martial weapons instead of only Martial Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Melee Mastery
entries: You can choose Melee weapons in addition to Ranged weapons when you select weapons for your Weapon Mastery.

entries.name: Ignore Loading
entries: You ignore {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} of the {@item Blunderbuss|ValdaGunslinger}, {@item Pistol|ValdaGunslinger}, and {@item Musket|ValdaGunslinger}. If you're holding one of them, you can load a piece of ammunition into it even if you lack a free hand.

entries.name: Bayonets
entries: You have proficiency with Bayonets. A Bayonet is a special {@item Dagger|XPHB} that can be attached or detached from any Ranged weapon with {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. While attached, you can treat the Ranged weapon as a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using the Bayonet, it deals Piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus the ability modifier used for the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmish [Maneuver]
entries: When you make an attack using a weapon, you can expend one Risk Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an attack using a weapon later on the same turn. One attack must be a melee attack roll and the other must be a ranged attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Morale Boost
entries: When you use the {@optfeature Bite the Bullet|ValdaGunslinger} maneuver, choose up to 5 allies you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Each chosen ally gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to one roll of your Risk Die plus half your Gunslinger level (round down).

subclassFeature.name: Mobile Tactics
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, the target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: All for One
entries: Whenever an ally within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged attack using a weapon against the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Gun-Ko Master
entries: {@i Wield Your Gun as a Total Weapon}

The ancient art of gun-ko is passed through generations of Gunslingers who study the gun as a perfect weapon and meditate on its intricacies. This path is not for the impatient or the faint of heart, but those who practice diligently can transform the gun into an extension of themselves, striking and shooting with mesmerizing speed.

subclassFeature.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Gun-Ko
entries: You learn the immortal art of gun-ko, which grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Bludgeon with Anything
entries: When you attack with a Ranged weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Bludgeon|ValdaGunslingerExtras} property for that attack.

entries.name: Bonus Action Strike
entries: When you make a ranged attack roll with a weapon against an enemy within 5 feet of you, you can make a melee attack using the {@itemMastery Bludgeon|ValdaGunslingerExtras} property of that weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Disarm [Maneuver]
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of you is holding a weapon, you can expend one Risk Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to attempt to take it. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or you take the weapon from it after a series of rapid movements. You must have a free hand to use this maneuver.

subclassFeature.name: Wall Dash [Maneuver]
entries: You can expend one Risk Die to take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Until the end of your turn, you have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and you can move across vertical surfaces while leaving your hands free.

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Dodge
entries: Your reflexes are honed enough to dodge incoming bullets. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you gain the benefits of the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action against the target's ranged attack rolls and its effects that force you to make a Dexterity saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Flash Assault
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make one ranged attack with a weapon and one melee attack using the {@itemMastery Bludgeon|ValdaGunslingerExtras} property of that weapon. You can move between these attacks. If you hit a Large or smaller creature with both attacks, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending two Risk Dice (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Laserist
entries: {@i Master High-Tech Blaster Weapons}

Gunslinging, as you well understand, is more science than art, especially when using cutting-edge blaster technology. As a Laserist, you're interested in maximizing blaster output while minimizing survivors, iterating and customizing your blasters to create the perfect weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Beam Shot [Maneuver]
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action using a weapon that has the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-B|ValdaGunslingerExtras|Blaster} property, you can expend one Risk Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to replace one of your attacks with a penetrating laser shot. This attack becomes a 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that extends out to the weapon's normal range. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} makes a Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save, a creature takes damage equal to the weapon's normal damage plus the Risk Die, or half as much on a successful one. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Multi-Mode Blaster
entries: You can spend 1 minute integrating two weapons with the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-B|ValdaGunslingerExtras|Blaster} property into a single chassis, granting you a supremely flexible weapon. You can only have one Multi-Mode Blaster at a time. Whenever you make an attack with the blaster, you choose which of the two integrated weapons you use for that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Charge Shot
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with charging a weapon that has the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-B|ValdaGunslingerExtras|Blaster} property that you are holding. Until the start of your next turn, the weapon is charging and can't be used to make an attack. Afterwards, the weapon is charged until the end of the turn. When you make an attack with a charged weapon, it deals two extra dice of damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Energetic Shield [Maneuver]
entries: You have installed a sophisticated electromagnetic device on your person. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} in response to taking Cold, Fire, Lighting, Necrotic, Radiant, or Thunder damage, you can expend one Risk Die to gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to this damage until the start of your next turn, including against the triggering damage.

subclassFeature.name: Refraction Shot
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a ranged attack using a weapon that has the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-B|ValdaGunslingerExtras|Blaster} property, you can cause the blaster bolt to deflect off the target to a second creature you can see within 30 feet of the original target. The target takes damage of the weapon's type equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Space Cowboy
entries: {@i Overheat Your Customized Blaster}

Nothing matters to you more than freedom. With a blaster on your hip and the wide-open sky to explore, you no longer have to answer to anyone. The perils of the final frontier tend to attract gamblers and risk-takers, be they unscrupulous smugglers, bloodthirsty bounty hunters, or big damn heroes.

subclassFeature.name: Hot Shot
entries: When you attack with a Ranged weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Overheat|ValdaGunslingerExtras} property for that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Gun with a Name
entries: Over a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can customize one of your Ranged weapons, causing it to become a Named Weapon. You can have only one Named Weapon at a time. This weapon has the following benefits.

entries.name: Extended Barrel
entries: The normal and long ranges of the Named Weapon double.

entries.name: Magnetic Mount
entries: The quantum electromagnet installed on the Named Weapon allows you to use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to pull the weapon to your open hand if it is within 60 feet of you and isn't being carried. You can't be disarmed of the weapon unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Reinforced Frame
entries: The Named Weapon gains the {@itemMastery Bludgeon|ValdaGunslingerExtras} mastery property in addition to its normal mastery property, though you can only use one mastery property on each attack. This property doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use with Weapon Mastery.

subclassFeature.name: Power Slide
entries: When you use the {@optfeature Dodge Roll|ValdaGunslinger} maneuver, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack you make before the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lucky Dodge
entries: Whenever you are hit by an attack roll, you can roll a {@dice d6} (no action required). On a 6, the attack misses you automatically.

subclassFeature.name: Red Line
entries: When you use the {@itemMastery Overheat|ValdaGunslingerExtras} mastery property, the Overheated weapon can be used again at the start of your next turn.

baseitem.name: Grenade
entries: Ammunition is required by a weapon that has {@itemProperty AF|XDMG|Ammunition}. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon.
Firearm ammunition is destroyed upon use.

baseitem.name: Antimatter Pistol
entries: A compact, antimatter-firing companion to the {@item Antimatter Carbine|ValdaGunslingerExtras}, the {@item Antimatter Pistol|ValdaGunslingerExtras} is an essential close-quarters backup.

baseitem.name: Avia-Ra Sunstaff
entries: This long staff, forked at its end near a prominent gemstone, is a blaster in its own right. When used in expert hands, the Sunstaff can bludgeon, trip, and strike foes as a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, only to be squeezed in both hands to fire a burst of hot plasma.

baseitem.name: Bolt Caster
entries: An early but reliable blaster design that resembles a crossbow, the Bolt Caster issues single shots of plasma with a long cooldown between shots.

baseitem.name: Ion Cannon
entries: The Ion Cannon fires a bright, diffuse cone, rendering it deadly up close. Between shots, it makes a quiet zipping noise, as the arcane battery charges the ion cell for another blast.

baseitem.name: Phaser
entries: Phasers aren't designed for effectiveness so much as portability and non-lethality. These blasters are often issued to peace-keepers and emissaries that require personal defense but have no intent to kill.

baseitem.name: Standard Carbine
entries: As its name might suggest, the Standard Carbine is the standard-issue blaster for all Hegemony and Coalition troops, which makes it one of the most pervasive weapons in the 'Verse. Spacers of all stripes employ it for its compact size and superb accuracy.

baseitem.name: Antimatter Carbine
entries: A more lethal model of the {@item Standard Carbine|ValdaGunslingerExtras}, this rifle can automatically fire bolts of antimatter with surprising accuracy.

baseitem.name: Blitz Cannon
entries: With its imposing rectangular muzzle, this brutalist weapon has a clear right and wrong end. Pulling its trigger unleashes a torrent of lightning bolts in a wide, imprecise spray, making it extremely dangerous at point-blank range.

baseitem.name: Concussion Rifle
entries: A series of arcane capacitors run the length of this rifle, terminating in a thick condenser that compresses its blast into a precise burst. A Concussion Rifle is especially deadly at long ranges, and its damage bypasses most energetically-resistant armor.

baseitem.name: Dueling Laser
entries: A pistol intended for honorable, one-on-one duels, the Dueling Laser fires a blinding streak of light and promptly overheats. Spacers favor a Dueling Laser in their offhand for an infrequent but powerful retort.

baseitem.name: Magnus
entries: This impressive handgun weighs almost twice that of a Repeater. Its infamous heft, recoil, and stopping power make it a favorite of spacers that accept no compromises.

baseitem.name: Plasma Launcher
entries: This short tube launches an orb of superheated plasma in an arc. On contact, the ball of plasma pops like a balloon, exploding in a dazzling fireball of sparks.

baseitem.name: REC Gun
entries: The Revolving Exothermic Cannon (or REC gun, for short) operates on the same principle as a conventional blaster, with an arcane battery hooked up to an aperture barrel and so forth, but mounts several blasters on a revolving cylinder and fires each in rapid succession. A tripod mount keeps the blaster stable despite its heft and shocking recoil.

baseitem.name: Repeater
entries: The quintessential handheld blaster, the Repeater is a staple on the Galactic Frontier. Solid, reliable, and packing just enough firepower to bring down an assailant, nearly every explorer worth their salt has one of these blasters strapped to their hip.

baseitem.name: Swarm Pistol
entries: This handheld blaster, styled much like a {@item Repeater|ValdaGunslingerExtras}, has a wickedly fast automatic fire, capable of spewing dozens of rays in seconds. Dexterous users might even find it possible to use one in each hand for a dazzling spectacle of plasma bolts.

feat.name: Blaster Master
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Blaster Roulette
entries: If you roll the same number of two damage dice for a weapon with the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-F|ValdaGunslinger|Firearm} property, you deal bonus damage equal to that number. You can only add this bonus damage once per turn.

items.name: Ignore Cooldown
entries: You ignore the {@itemProperty GC:VSS-C|ValdaGunslingerExtras|Cooldown} property of weapons.

items.name: Run and Gun
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, you can make a ranged attack using a weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blaster
entries: A weapon with the Blaster property is a Ranged weapon that requires no ammunition. This property counts as {@itemProperty A|XPHB|Ammunition}.

entries.name: Cooldown
entries: Because this weapon requires cooldown time between uses, you can only fire it once when you use an action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you normally make. This property counts as {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}.

itemMastery.name: Bludgeon
entries: You can treat this weapon as a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, it deals Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus the ability modifier used for the attack roll, or {@dice 1d8} if the weapon is used with two hands to make the attack.

itemMastery.name: Jolt
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, the creature can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

itemMastery.name: Mounted
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mount this weapon in a fixed position until the end of your turn. A damage value in parentheses appears with this property. While mounted, the weapon deals that damage when used to make a ranged attack, and the weapon can't be moved.

itemMastery.name: Overheat
entries: If you hit a target with this weapon, you can overcharge the weapon. If you do so, the target takes extra damage of the weapon's type equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The weapon then Overheats. An Overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.
